Package ispd.arquivo.xml.models.builders

Class GridQueueNetworkParser

java.lang.Object
ispd.arquivo.xml.models.builders.GridQueueNetworkParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
CloudQueueNetworkParser
public class GridQueueNetworkParser extends Object
Class to build a queue network from a model in a WrappedDocument. Usage should be as follows: 

 new GridQueueNetworkParser()
 .parseDocument(doc)
 .build();
See methods parseDocument(WrappedDocument) and build() for further details.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GridQueueNetworkParser

      public GridQueueNetworkParser()

  • Method Details

    • processClusterElement

      protected void processClusterElement (WrappedElement e)
      Process a WrappedElement that is representing a cluster of Services. The GridMaster, GridMachines and Links in the cluster are differentiated and all processed individually.
      Parameters:
      e - WrappedElement representing a cluster.

    • parseDocument

      public GridQueueNetworkParser parseDocument (WrappedDocument doc)
      Parse the required Services and user power limits from the given WrappedDocument.
      Parameters:
      doc - the WrappedDocument to be processed. Must contain a valid model.
      Returns:
      the called instance itself, so the call can be chained into a build() if so desired.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this instance was already used to parse a WrappedDocument.

    • makeAndAddMachine

      protected Processing makeAndAddMachine (WrappedElement e)
      Build and process the machine (more specifically, the Processing represented by the WrappedElement e. Since the machine may or may not be a master, it can be added to either the collection of masters or machines.
      Parameters:
      e - WrappedElement representing a Processing.
      Returns:
      the interpreted Processing from the given WrappedElement. May either be a GridMaster or a GridMachine.

    • increaseUserPower

      protected void increaseUserPower (String userId, double increment)
      Increase the power limit of the user with given id by the given amount.
      Parameters:
      userId - id of the user whose power limit will be increased.
      increment - amount to increment the power limit by. Should be positive.

    • addSlavesToProcessingCenter

      protected void addSlavesToProcessingCenter (Processing master, Service slave)
      Add Service slave to the list of slaves of the Processing master (which is always interpreted as an instance of GridMaster. Note that master is a master, and Processing may either be:
      • another master
      • a non-master machine
      • a switch
      In any case, the method process the element appropriately and updates the necessary master-slave relations.
      Parameters:
      master - an instance of GridMaster.
      slave - slave Service.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the given Processing master is not an instance of GridMaster.

    • build

      public GridQueueNetwork build()
      Create a GridQueueNetwork with the collections parsed from the document. The method parseDocument(WrappedDocument) must already have been called on the instance.
      Returns:
      GridQueueNetwork with the appropriate service centers, links, and user configurations found in the document.

    • setSchedulersUserMetrics

      protected void setSchedulersUserMetrics (UserPowerLimit helper)
      For all GridMasters parsed from the document, update its GridSchedulingPolicy's user metrics with the obtained user power limit information.
      Parameters:
      helper - UserPowerLimit with the power limit information.

    • initQueueNetwork

      protected GridQueueNetwork initQueueNetwork()
      Construct a GridQueueNetwork with the parsed Services and user power limit information.
      Returns:
      initialized GridQueueNetwork.
